text: The U.S. House Financial Services Subcommittee on Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions is a subcommittee of the House Committee on Financial Services. ==Jurisdiction== The subcommittee is in charge of overseeing all financial regulators, such as the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the Federal Reserve. It is also in charge of all issues about consumer credit, including the Consumer Credit Protection Act, and access to financial services, as well as the safety of the banking system. ==Members, 116th Congress== Majority Minority * Gregory Meeks, New York, Chair * David Scott, Georgia * Nydia Vel√°zquez, New York * Lacy Clay, Missouri * Denny Heck, Washington * Bill Foster, Illinois * Al Lawson, Florida * Rashida Tlaib, Michigan * Katie Porter, California * Ayanna Pressley, Massachusetts * Ben McAdams, Utah * Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, New York * Jennifer Wexton, Virginia * Blaine Luetkemeyer, Missouri, Ranking Member * Frank Lucas, Oklahoma * Bill Posey, Florida * Andy Barr, Kentucky * Scott Tipton, Colorado, Vice Ranking Member * Roger Williams, Texas * Barry Loudermilk, Georgia * Ted Budd, North Carolina * David Kustoff, Tennessee * Denver Riggleman, Virginia Ex officio Ex officio * Maxine Waters, California * Patrick McHenry, North Carolina ==Other websites== *Official page Financial Services Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions
